meta.content: A story told with Adobe Spark

meta.name: twitter:description
meta.content: A story told with Adobe Spark

div.h4: “Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.” ― Theodore Roosevelt

div.h3: Resources for Learning and Thriving at Home:

div.a: Eaton Public Library Online. Books, movies, classes, magazines, and music! FREE!
Websites for Families While Learning at Home
Colorado Department of Education Resource Page
Rocky Mountain PBS TV Show for At-Home Learning

div.p: Emergency Childcare: While many are unable to work, others are still working and are considered "essential" in the fight to slow the spread of COVID-19 in our state. They include about 80,000 first responders who have young children, according to Governor Jared Polis.

Unemployment or Lost Hours: The Colorado Dep. of Labor and Employment (CDLE) announced Monday that it will give assistance for workers and employers during the temporary closures. Workers who have a reduction in hours or wages may file an unemployment claim by clicking here. To find out if you're eligible or to calculate what your potential benefits might be click/tap here.
Housing and shelter resources: If you're unsure if you'll be able to continue making rent or mortgage payments, there are a variety of assistance programs.

Maybe it is time for a career change? Adult learners can use their time alongside their children. Access career building resources and take FREE classes for adults through the Eaton Public Library! Learn to code with a scholarship from CodeAcademy.

div.a: Eaton Public Library Resources for Adults
Scholarships for Coding Classes at CodeAcademy!

div.p: Small Businesses are eligible for financial relief. Visit the Small Business Development Center for information.

div.a: Weld County Employment Services Disaster Relief

div.p: Eaton School District will distribute meals to families every Friday starting March 27th from 9 to 11 am at EHS and GES. Contact Becky Lawhead at blawhead@eaton.k12.co.us or 970-454-3402 x 615 with questions.
For more food or to donate food items please contact the Weld Food Bank. 1108 H Street Greeley, CO 80631. 970-356-2199
Updated health information on COVID-19 is available at the Weld County Health Department. Hotline: (970) 400-2111
Students that need Chromebooks should contact their principals. We will distribute them on Monday, March 30th. Your principals will notify you of the scheduled pick-up time.
Families can access the schools WiFi for free in the parking lot at Eaton High School, Eaton Middle School, and Galeton Elementary. The Eaton Public Library also has free WiFi in their parking lot.
Various internet and phone providers are offering free access for 60 days. Their contact information is below.
Ascent Broadband Offering Free installation and service for the remainder of the school year.
TDS: New customers with students or financial need will be eligible for 60 days of free internet access, to help assist with work- or school-at-home scenarios. Call 1-844-239-9621.
Created with images by Matthew Waring - "Help and support" • Josh Appel - "untitled image" • Hush Naidoo - "This was captured well waiting for the doctor who was busy at the time"
